definition.value: A bodily process that is clinically abnormal.

name: pathological bodily process
body: A bodily process that is clinically abnormal.

definition.value: Demyelination is a pathological bodily process that produces damage to the myelin sheath of neurons.

children.name: demyelination
children.body: Demyelination is a pathological bodily process that produces damage to the myelin sheath of neurons.

definition.value: Neurodegeneration is a pathological bodily process that produces the loss of structure or function of neurons and can also produce the death of neurons.

children.name: neurodegeneration
children.body: Neurodegeneration is a pathological bodily process that produces the loss of structure or function of neurons and can also produce the death of neurons.

definition.value: Pathological aggresomal response is the process that occurs when an aggresomal response becomes a pathological bodily process.  A pathological aggresomal response typically (always???) produces (results in???) too many aggresomes, which then typically become the material basis of one or more diseases.

children.name: pathological aggresomal response
children.body: Pathological aggresomal response is the process that occurs when an aggresomal response becomes a pathological bodily process.  A pathological aggresomal response typically (always???) produces (results in???) too many aggresomes, which then typically become the material basis of one or more diseases.

definition.value: A pathological process that results in abnormal growth or maintence of white matter in an organism's brain.

children.name: dysmyelination
children.body: A pathological process that results in abnormal growth or maintence of white matter in an organism's brain.

definition.value: A specific humoral or cell-mediated immune response against autologous (self) antigens. An autoimmune process may produce or be caused by autoimmune disease and may be developmentally complex, not necessarily pathological, and possibly pervasive.

children.name: autoimmune process
children.body: A specific humoral or cell-mediated immune response against autologous (self) antigens. An autoimmune process may produce or be caused by autoimmune disease and may be developmentally complex, not necessarily pathological, and possibly pervasive.

definition.value: Clinical or subclinical disturbances of cortical function due to a sudden, abnormal, excessive, and disorganized discharge of brain cells. Clinical manifestations include abnormal motor, sensory and psychic phenomena. Recurrent seizures are usually referred to as EPILEPSY or seizure disorder.

children.name: seizure
children.body: Clinical or subclinical disturbances of cortical function due to a sudden, abnormal, excessive, and disorganized discharge of brain cells. Clinical manifestations include abnormal motor, sensory and psychic phenomena. Recurrent seizures are usually referred to as EPILEPSY or seizure disorder.

definition.value:
Clinical or subclinical disturbances of cortical function due to a sudden, abnormal, excessive, and disorganized discharge of brain cells. Clinical manifestations include abnormal motor, sensory and psychic phenomena. Recurrent seizures are usually referred to as EPILEPSY or "seizure disorder." 

Convulsions brought on by a fever in infants or small children. During a febrile seizure, a child often loses consciousness and shakes.

children.name: febrile seizure
children.body:
Clinical or subclinical disturbances of cortical function due to a sudden, abnormal, excessive, and disorganized discharge of brain cells. Clinical manifestations include abnormal motor, sensory and psychic phenomena. Recurrent seizures are usually referred to as EPILEPSY or "seizure disorder." 

Convulsions brought on by a fever in infants or small children. During a febrile seizure, a child often loses consciousness and shakes.

definition.value: A pathological bodily process in which matter is reorganized in such a way as to give rise to new pathological formations which take the place of entities existing earlier.

children.name: pathological derivation
children.body: A pathological bodily process in which matter is reorganized in such a way as to give rise to new pathological formations which take the place of entities existing earlier.

definition.value: A pathological bodily process in which a canonical anatomical structure becomes a pathological anatomical structure.

children.name: pathological transformation
children.body: A pathological bodily process in which a canonical anatomical structure becomes a pathological anatomical structure.

definition.value: A pathological bodily process that occurs in the fetus during fetal development

children.name: congenital process
children.body: A pathological bodily process that occurs in the fetus during fetal development

definition.value: The process in which an allergic disease unfolds.

children.name: allergic disease process
children.body: The process in which an allergic disease unfolds.

definition.value: The process in which cancer unfolds

children.name: cancer process
children.body: The process in which cancer unfolds

definition.value: The process in which an autoimmune disease unfolds.

children.name: autoimmune disease process
children.body: The process in which an autoimmune disease unfolds.

definition.value: The process in which an infectious disease unfolds

children.name: infectious disease process
children.body: The process in which an infectious disease unfolds
